Asset prices fell by 50% everywhere. And a lot of makerdao CDP's were auctioned off. And because Ethereum and the mempool was so congested, nobody was able to bid on the CDP's or these vaults that created Dai. And so all of this Makerdao collateral was auctioned off for $0 and it created pandemonium. And today, makerdao actually looks very different than the way it looked black Thursday four years ago. Today, the system is not how most people remember it. It's not a system where all Dai is created through vaults owned by individual users that it's ether collateral or rap bitcoin collateral. And if the prices go down, it gets auctioned off. Most Dai is backed by what was called the peg stability module. And this was created as a response to black Thursday four years ago. The peg stability module said, hey, if there's a market dislocation and people want to get out of Dai, we can't assume that there's enough bid in the market to soak up that die. Why doesnt Makerdao, the protocol have a big bucket of USDC? So that when you want to sell Dai, youre basically selling it back to Makerdao, the protocol for a dollar of USDC and you dont have to have organic market demand to buy Dai. The second you want to sell it and you dont have this synchronicity between supply and demand for Dai. The stablecoin itself and the PSM has done a phenomenal job over the past couple of years creating Dai price stability. Unlike Black Thursday four years ago, the price of Dai has been basically a dollar since then. Why? Well, no one really wants to pay more than a dollar for a Dai, and there's more than enough USDC to sell it for a dollar. And so the price has basically done a phenomenal job being pegged to USDC. And really what's causing this dislocation is that the PSM is being drained. And so when you visualize what is Makerdao, the system, it's almost like it's slowly returning to its roots of like, hey, there's not that many stable coins backing this that are owned by the protocol.
